templates.name: CategoryInfoBox Cemetery
templates.help: Template that should be used on all cemetery categories. It automatically adds categories for '''parent''', '''parent1''' and '''location''' parameters to the cemetery category.

prop.name: name
prop.help: Name of the cemetery. It represents just the title of the CategoryInfoBox

prop.name: aka
prop.help: Additional names of the cemetery. Separated by semicolon.

prop.name: address
prop.help: Address of the cemetery. In one line, without the name.
prop.example: 400 Veterans Avenue, Biloxi, Harrison County, Mississippi Tel: 228-388-6668

prop.name: affiliation
prop.help: Organizational affiliation associated with the cemetery (Religion/Church, IOOF, Freemasons, etc.).

prop.name: affiliation1
prop.help: Organizational affiliation associated with the cemetery (Religion/Church, IOOF, Freemasons, etc.).
prop.example: Oakridge Baptist Church, Vancouver, British Columbia

prop.name: parent
prop.help: Name of the lowest parent category that groups the cemeteries. It automatically adds ", Cemeteries" if missing.

prop.name: parent1
prop.help: Additional name of the lowest parent category that groups the cemeteries. It doesn't automatically add ", Cemeteries".

prop.name: parent1sort
prop.help: Sets sort key for parent1 category. You should know that only the first letter is used for sorting.

prop.name: project
prop.help: Name of the project, that oversees the categories.

prop.name: location
prop.help: Name of the lowest location category that the cemetery is located in.

prop.name: location1
prop.help: Name of the lowest location category usually in a parallel language hierarchy.

prop.name: spacepage
prop.help: Name of the associated Free Space Page without the Space: prefix.

prop.name: wikidataID
prop.help: WikiDataID of the cemetery. Only if the cemetery has Wikipedia/Wikidata page. Do not use the page of location.

prop.name: findagraveID
prop.help: ID of the cemetery on FindAGrave website. It is the number in URL of the cemetery.

prop.name: billiongravesID
prop.help: ID of the cemetery on BillionGraves website. It is the name and the number in URL of the cemetery, that is after /cemetery/ in the URL.

prop.name: webpage
prop.help: Full URL of the cemetery webpage.

prop.name: webpagetext
prop.help: Text to display on the webpage link. If omitted text "Web page" is displayed.

prop.name: searchwebpage
prop.help: Full URL of the webpage with search capability.

prop.name: coordinate
prop.help: Latitude and longitude of the cemetery, separated by comma. It is displayed in URL on OpenStreetMap or Google.

prop.name: startdate
prop.help: Year of the first burial on the cemetery.

prop.name: enddate
prop.help: Year of the last burial on the cemetery.

prop.name: image
prop.help: Image name on WikiTree, that is shown on the top.

prop.name: imageleft
prop.help: Image name on WikiTree, that is shown on left hand side.

prop.name: imageright
prop.help: Image name on WikiTree, that is shown on right hand side.

prop.name: team
prop.help: The team parameter is no longer available in this template, and should be removed.

templates.name: CategoryInfoBox Structure
templates.help: Template that should be used on all categories representing historical structures (forts, castles, meeting houses, missions, etc.). It automatically adds categories for '''parent''' and '''location''' parameters to the category.

prop.name: name
prop.help: Name of the structure. It represents just the title of the CategoryInfoBox

prop.name: aka
prop.help: Additional names of the structure. Separated by semicolon.
prop.example: The Alamo; Shrine of Texas Liberty; Misión de Álamo

prop.name: lang
prop.help: [[Wikipedia:List_of_ISO_639-1_codes

prop.name: address
prop.help: Address of the structure. In one line, without the name.

prop.name: parent
prop.help: Name of the lowest parent category that groups the strctures.

prop.name: parent1
prop.help: Additional name of the lowest parent category that groups the strctures.

prop.name: parent2

prop.name: team
prop.help: Name of the team within the project, that oversees the categories. Enter it without the Team ending.

prop.name: location

prop.name: spacepage
prop.help: Name of the associated Free Space Page without the Space: prefix.

prop.name: wikidataID
prop.help: WikiDataID of the strcture. Only if the strcture has Wikipedia/Wikidata page. Do not use the page of location.

prop.name: webpagetext1
prop.help: Text to display on the webpage link. If omitted text "Web page" is displayed.

prop.name: searchwebpage
prop.help: Full URL of the webpage with search capability.

prop.name: coordinate
prop.help: Latitude and longitude of the strcture, separated by comma. It is displayed in URL on OpenStreetMap or Google.

prop.name: image

prop.name: profiles
prop.help: If it is set to no, Top Level Category text is added to the box.  If it is maybe Mid Level Category is assumed.

templates.name: CategoryInfoBox Unsourced
templates.help: CategoryInfoBox Unsourced is a template to put on all Unsourced Profiles categories. It automatically adds categories for '''parent''' and '''location''' parameters to the cemetery category.

prop.name: name
prop.help: Name of the Unsourced Profiles category without Unsourced Profiles.

prop.name: parent
prop.help: Name of the parent Unsourced Profiles category without Unsourced Profiles. Or main for the top and 1st level categories.

prop.name: location
prop.help: Name of the associated Location Category. Or name if it is the same as name parameter

prop.help: Name of the project, that oversees the categories.

prop.name: report
prop.help: Name code of the Unsourced report made by WikiTree+.

prop.help: Name of the associated resource category. Or yes if it is the same as name parameter + Genealogy Resources

prop.name: centurynavigator
prop.help: Value full gives links to WT+ for all centuries, part makes links from 15 cen and empty is for no century navigation.

prop.name: profiles
prop.help: If it is set to no, Top Level Category text is added to the box.

prop.name: sortkey
prop.help: Text to use for sorting in parent categories. Enables to sort the category without The at the beginning. entering no disables sorting in location categories.

templates.name: Ancestry Image
templates.help: To link to an image of a record on Ancestry.

prop.name: database
prop.help: Database name or number. It is the first number in the URL of the image, e.g.: <nowiki>https://www.ancestry.com/interactive/1234/5678</nowiki>.

prop.name: record
prop.help: Image number. It is the second number in the URL of the image, e.g.: <nowiki>https://www.ancestry.com/interactive/1234/5678</nowiki>.

templates.name: Ancestry Record
templates.help: To link to an indexed record on Ancestry

prop.name: database
prop.help: Database name or number. It can be found after the "db=" in the URL of the record, e.g.: <nowiki>https://search.ancestry.com/cgi-bin/sse.dll?db=1234&h=5678&indiv=try</nowiki>.

prop.name: record
prop.help: Record number. It can be found after the "h=" in the URL of the record, e.g.: <nowiki>https://search.ancestry.com/cgi-bin/sse.dll?db=1234&h=5678&indiv=try</nowiki>.

prop.name: site
prop.help: International Ancestry sites (uk - Ancestry.co.uk, ca - Ancestry.ca, au - Ancestry.com.au, de - Ancestry.de, it - Ancestry.it, fr - Ancestry.fr, se - Ancestry.se, mx - Ancestry.mx)

templates.name: Ancestry Sharing
templates.help: To link to a shared document on Ancestry.

prop.help: The first number in the URL of the link, e.g.: <nowiki>https://www.ancestry.com/sharing/</nowiki>'''25304603'''?h=8b8bd6or or <nowiki>https://www.ancestry.com/sharing/</nowiki>'''130047'''?token=fueo0lzU7uYSbCYEezUKuLpE313y4cK2VdcT3PD9vG0%3D.

The string after "h=" or "?token=" in the URL of the link, e.g.: <nowiki>https://www.ancestry.com/sharing/</nowiki>25304603?h='''8b8bd6''' or <nowiki>https://www.ancestry.com/sharing/</nowiki>130047?token='''fueo0lzU7uYSbCYEezUKuLpE313y4cK2VdcT3PD9vG0%3D'''.

templates.name: Ancestry Tree
templates.help: To link to a family tree on Ancestry. [[Help:Links to Ancestry]]

prop.name: tree
prop.help: Tree number.  It is the first number in the URL of the tree, e.g.: <nowiki>https://www.ancestry.com/family-tree/person/tree/1234/person/19531917216/facts</nowiki>.

prop.name: person
prop.help: Person number. It is the second number in the URL of the image, e.g.: <nowiki>https://www.ancestry.com/family-tree/person/tree/1234/person/5678/facts</nowiki>.

templates.name: Ancestry Tree Media
templates.help: To link to a picture or document in someone's Ancestry Tree.

prop.name: tree
prop.help: Tree number.  It is the first number in the URL of the tree, e.g.: <nowiki>https://www.ancestry.com/family-tree/tree/1234/media/5678</nowiki>.

prop.name: media
prop.help: Media identifier. It is the second number in the URL of the image, e.g.: <nowiki>https://www.ancestry.com/family-tree/person/tree/1234/media/5678</nowiki>.

templates.help: This template is used to escape the raw pipe character (|) where markup containing it (i.e., a table) needs to be passed as a parameter. Parser functions will mangle wikitable syntax and pipe characters, treating all the raw pipe characters as parameter dividers. This template 'hides' the pipe from the MediaWiki parser, ensuring that it is not read until after all of the variables on a page have been expanded. It will then be interpreted as a table row or column separator.

templates.name: Documentation
templates.help:
This template is used to transclude a template's documentation and instructions from a subpage, to the main template page. Due to the powerful nature of templates, and the need for server resources to be used when updating template pages, template documentation should now be housed under the template's subpage ('/docs'). This prevents any documentation updates from utilizing unnecessary server resources to update any pages using the template.
For instance, if the template is named 'Template:X', the subpage which contains the documentation will be located at 'Template:X/docs'.

templates.name: Disputed Parents
templates.help:
<nowiki>{{Disputed Parents}}</nowiki> is a Research Note Box for when there are disproven, disputed, or competing theories about a mother, father, or both parents that are common enough to warrant drawing the attention of anyone viewing the profile. When used, at least one disputed theory should be explained in or linked from a [[Help:Research Notes|Research Notes]] section.
The disputed parent(s) may or may not be connected. If they are connected, also use <nowiki>{{</nowiki>[[Template:Uncertain Family|Uncertain Family]]<nowiki>}}</nowiki>.
'''See [[Help:Uncertain_Parents]] for more usage instructions.'''

prop.help: The disputed parent

templates.name: Disputed Spouse
templates.help:
<nowiki>{{Disputed Spouse}}</nowiki> is a Research Note Box for when there are disproven, disputed, or competing theories about spouses that are common enough to warrant drawing the attention of anyone viewing the profile. When used, at least one disputed theory should be explained in or linked from a Research Notes section.
The disputed spouse may or may not be connected. If they are connected, also use <nowiki>{{</nowiki>[[Template:Uncertain Spouse|Uncertain Spouse]]<nowiki>}}</nowiki>.

templates.name: Slave LNAB
templates.help: The purpose of the template is to inform others that the assigned last name at birth (LNAB) for the profile of those enslaved may not be accurate. A placeholder LNAB has been given based on the [[Space:US_Black_Heritage:_Naming_Conventions_for_Slaves|Naming Conventions for Slaves]] until a documented name can be found. This helps descendants find their ancestors more easily. Adding this template will place the profile automatically in the USBH Heritage Exchange, Needs LNAB category.

templates.name: Project Box
templates.help:
This template is the formatting container for [[Help:Project Boxes|project box]] templates. The primary purpose of a Project Box is to identify a project-managed profile so that visitors can find out how to collaborate on the profile and related profiles.
This template should not be used by itself directly on a profile, free-space page, or category page, and should only be used by other project box templates. If you are the leader of a [[Help:Projects|project]] but are not a [https://www.wikitree.com/index.php?title=Special:Badges&b=templates Template Editor], please contact [[Project:Templates]] for help on creating and editing your project's Project Boxes.

prop.help: Name of the additional category you want profiles using this project box to go in.

prop.name: image
prop.help: The image that will appear (as a small thumbnail) in the project box.

prop.name: image-caption
prop.help: A short description of the image. This is primarily for the benefit of the visually-impaired users of the site, and should basically say what the image is.

prop.name: description
prop.help: A short description that applies to all profiles that will use this project box.
prop.example: This person was the president of the United States.

prop.name: project
prop.help: The name of the project this project box is associated with.

prop.name: projectalias
prop.help: Actual name of the project used in needs categories.

prop.name: tag
prop.help: The official G2G tag for the project. It should be uppercase, with underscores instead of spaces and no accented or special characters

templates.name: New Netherland Community
templates.help:
This template creates a project box for use on the profiles of people who were present in the New Netherland area or played an important part in the history or community of New Netherland, but do not meet the criteria of being a New Netherland Settler or a descendant of a Settler.  For example, the template may be used on profiles of: 
*Dutch West India Company officials who participated in the governance of New Netherland but never settled there.
* Huguenot settlers who arrived in the New Netherland area between 1674 and 1700, including some children of those settlers born soon after 1700.
* British soldiers stationed in New York after 1674 who settled there and married daughters of New Netherland settlers. 
* Dutch Church clergy assigned to serve the New Netherland community in the years after Dutch governance ended.
:The project box template should be used only on profiles of New Netherland Community members that have the New Netherland Settlers Project as a profile manager, or that are thought to need to have the project as a profile manager.

templates.name: New Netherland Descendant
templates.help:
This Project Box is for use on profiles of descendants (born through 1776) of New Netherland settlers (note: settlers are defined as people who were in New Netherland before October 1674) that are managed by the New Netherland Settlers Project. This project box may be used on profiles of people born through 1776 who had New Netherland settler ancestors. The project box automatically adds the profile to the "New Netherland Descendants" category.  
Profiles for descendants of New Netherland settlers who were born after 1776 may use the [[Template: New Netherland Descendant Sticker|New Netherland Descendant Sticker]] instead of this project box. The  sticker may also be used for profiles of people born before 1776 whose profiles are not deemed to need management by the project.
The sticker [[Template:Low_Dutch_Kentucky|Low Dutch Kentucky]] is appropriate for New Netherland descendants who settled in "Low Dutch" communities in Kentucky.

templates.name: Puritan Great Migration Adjunct
templates.help:
The Puritan Great Migration Project has a particular interest in the English origins of early 17th century immigrants to the New England colonies.  Because of the fairly large number of false, fraudulent, disproven and speculative origin theories found on the internet and in older published works, the PGM project may also manage and Project Protect profiles which do not strictly fall in the PGM guidelines.  This is done to improve the accuracy and reliability of wikitree.  These profiles might include:
* Immigrants to New England who arrived after 1640 who have known false origins/parents.
* People who never immigrated to New England but are commonly confused with someone who did.
* Profiles of people who are commonly associated with PGM immigrants in error.  For example, people who have been disproved as parents of a PGM immigrant.
* People with speculative connections to PGM immigrants where the evidence is not strong enough to attach them to the immigrant.

templates.name: US Southern Colonist Adjunct
templates.help:
Adjunct: something joined or added to another thing but not essentially a part of it. [https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/adjunct Merriam-Webster]

The US Southern Colonies Project has a particular interest in persons born or settled in the colonies of Maryland, Virginia, the Carolinas, and Georgia prior to 4 July 1776—referred to as US Southern Colonists by the project. Because of the large number of false, fraudulent, disproven and speculative origin theories found on the internet and in various published works, the US Southern Colonies Project may also project manage and protect profiles which do not strictly fall in the project scope. This is done to improve the accuracy and reliability of WikiTree. These profiles might include: *People who never immigrated to the US Southern Colonies but are commonly confused with someone who did. *People claimed as US Southern Colonists who have false, fraudulent, disproven and speculative origin theories. *People who are commonly associated with US Southern Colonists in error. For example, people disproved as parents of a US Southern Colonist. *People with speculative connections to US Southern Colonists where the evidence is not strong enough to attach them to the US Southern Colonist.

templates.name: Heritage Sticker
templates.help:
This sticker can be used to show your heritage in ways that available stickers do not. While many projects have heritage stickers - for example [[Template: Wales Roots|{{Wales Roots}}]] - not all do, and not all locations have projects. You can see what stickers are available at [[:Category: Stickers]], which lists all stickers in the main category (because all stickers use the base "Sticker" template, they are all added to [[:Category: Stickers]]). They are also listed at [[Automated:Template_Sticker|Automated List of Stickers]] and the [[Space: Relationship Stickers#Project-Specific Stickers|Project-Specific Stickers]] and [[Space: Relationship Stickers#Heritage Stickers|Heritage Stickers]] sections of the [[Space:Relationship Stickers|Relationship Stickers space page]].

'''Note''': If you're looking for a "born in" or "lived in" ("lives in") option not found in those lists, the Templates Project recommends using the [[Template: Nonmigrating Ancestor|Nonmigrating Ancestor]] sticker.

templates.name: Recognition Sticker
templates.help:
This sticker can be used to recognize participation in a WikiTree project or challenge. While [[:Category:WikiTree_Leaders|WikiTree Leaders]] can award a "Winner Badge" for winners of challenges, this sticker is a less formal, less competitive way of recognizing the achievements and contributions of project members, both within a challenge and within the project. 
To award the Recognition Sticker, project leaders, project coordinators, or challenge leaders can send the coding to WikiTree members to place in their profiles via private message.

templates.name: 1776 Sticker
templates.help:
This sticker is for use on profiles of American Revolution soldiers. For the [[Help:Project Boxes|Project Box]] that is used on [[Help:Project-Managed Profiles|Project-Managed Profiles]], please see [[Template:1776 Project]]. For more information on the American Revolution, see [[Project:1776]], or you can ask a question in {{G2G}} using the tags {{Tag Link|1776}} and {{Tag Link|Stickers}}.
:Valid parameters for this sticker are:
::{{!}}image=''cooper-1.jpg''
::{{!}}rank=''Captain''
::{{!}}unit=''Pittsylvania County Militia, Virginia Militia, American Revolution''
''{{Red|Note: The unit parameter is designed to provide categorization if the category already exists and is named correctly. If the category does not yet exist, the profile will be categorized to a 1776 Project Maintenance Category for review.}}''

prop.name: rank
prop.help: the rank of the soldier to display on the sticker, else the profile Prefix is field is used

templates.name: ANZAC
templates.help:
This sticker is intended for use on profiles relating to the [[Project:ANZACS|ANZACS Project]] and will assign the [[:Category:ANZAC|appropriate ANZAC category]]. If a conflict not specified below is used, the template will apply '''<nowiki>[[Category:Anzacs:<conflict name>]]</nowiki>''' to the profile, and will display either the Australian Rising Sun Badge (sixth pattern) or the New Zealand Onward badge. If the conflict is omitted entirely, the template will instead apply the higher level category '''<nowiki>[[Category:ANZAC]]</nowiki>'''.
:'''Conflict Parameters''' :
*Boer War
*World War One
*World War Two
*Korean War
*Vietnam War
:'''Nationality Parameters''' :
* AU (default is nationality parameter is omitted)
* NZ

templates.name: World War II Sticker
templates.help:
This sticker is for use on profiles of World War II soldiers. For the [[Help:Project Boxes|Project Box]] that is used on [[Help:Project-Managed Profiles|Project-Managed Profiles]], please see [[Template:World War II Project]]. For more information on World War II, see [[Project:World War II]], or you can ask a question in {{G2G}} using the tags {{Tag Link|WWII}} and {{Tag Link|Stickers}}.
This template was designed to replace the original <nowiki>{{World War II}}</nowiki> sticker, which will be decommissioned in the future. For this template to provide categorization of profiles, the <nowiki>|branch=</nowiki> and <nowiki>|unit=</nowiki> parameters must be provided and named correctly, and the resulting category must already exist. If the category does not yet exist, the profile will be categorized to a World War II Project Maintenance Category for review.

prop.name: branch
prop.help: The branch that the soldier served in.

prop.name: rank
prop.help: the rank of the soldier to display on the sticker, else the profile Prefix is field is used

prop.name: image
prop.help: the name of the WikiTree image file to show on the sticker

prop.name: country
prop.help: AutoGenerated

templates.name: Jamestown Sticker
templates.help: Use this sticker for Jamestown settlers and officials. If the person is included in the 1624/5 Jamestown Muster, no parameters are needed. See the examples below to change the sticker to note the person was an official or what ship he or she arrived on. The base sticker and settler sticker (muster and ship) are intended only for people in Jamestown before it became a crown colony in 1624/5. For information about Jamestowne Society Qualifying Ancestors, which include later settlers, see [http://www.jamestowne.org/qualifying-ancestors.html this Jamestowne Society page] and [[Space: Checklist of Jamestowne Society Qualifying Ancestors|this WikiTree page]] (which shows those with WikiTree profiles). See [[Space:Stickers for Jamestown Colony|Stickers for Jamestown Colony]] for tailored Descendant stickers. This sticker is administered by [[Project: US Southern Colonies|US Southern Colonies Project]]'s [[Space:US Southern Colonies Jamestown Team|Jamestown Team]] (usage) and [[Space: US Southern Colonies Categories Team|Categories Team]] (maintenance).

prop.name: sticker type
prop.help: select the sticker type, or not

prop.name: ship
prop.help: Required with "settler" parameter

prop.name: year
prop.help: Required with "settler" parameter

See [[Space:Stickers for Jamestown Colony|Stickers for Jamestown Colony]] for tailored Descendant stickers. Sticker administered by [[Project: US Southern Colonies|US Southern Colonies Project]]'s [[Space:US Southern Colonies Jamestown Team|Jamestown Team]] (usage) and [[Space: US Southern Colonies Categories Team|Categories Team]] (maintenance).

templates.name: US Southern Colonist Sticker
templates.help:
This sticker is for all persons who have been identified as being US Southern Colonists (covering Maryland, Virginia, the Carolinas and Georgia before 1776). Please add a colony parameter (colony switch) to properly categorize the person. Select the colony where the immigrant first settled or the colonist was born: without the colony parameter, the sticker adds [[:Category:US Southern Colonists]]; the colony parameter will add the appropriate subcategory instead, as well as change the text of the sticker.

This is a [[Project: US Southern Colonies |US Southern Colonies Project]] sticker (point of contact: the project's [[Space: US Southern Colonies Categories Team|Categories Team]]).

templates.help: This Sticker may be used for any person who has been identified as having African ancestry, including active WikiTree members. It may be used regardless of African country or ethnic group and is especially helpful for those who don't know which specific area of Africa they originate from. You may also add one of the 19 major people groups of Africa. (Note: specific country stickers will be created in the future)

templates.name: African-American Sticker
templates.help: This Sticker may be used on any profile for a Black American who lived in the United States of America. It is meant to honor their Black heritage and their Black experience in the USA. It is not meant for worldwide use. This sticker is essential for the US Black Heritage Project for profile counting and tracking. If the profile is managed by the project, use the [[Project:African-American|US Black Heritage]] project box instead.

templates.name: Global Cemeteries
templates.help:
This template was previously used for documenting burials in coordination with the [[Project:Cemeterist|Cemeterist Project]] (previously called 'Global Cemeteries'). While some members still use this template, '''the Cemeterist Project does not require or suggest its usage on profiles'''. Instead, we promote the support the profiles of our deceased ancestors by using original photos, research, reliable sources, and appropriate categorization.

''{{Red|Note:This template was formally a project box; however, it did not meet the template guidelines and was reformatted to display as a sticker. Ideally, this template should not be used on any new profiles.}}''

Categories can be added by clicking the [[Help:Categorization#How_to_Categorize_a_Profile|category icon]] while in edit mode.

templates.name: Homesteaders
templates.help:
This [[Help:Sticker|sticker]] identifies and recognizes profiles of people who were [[Space:Homesteaders|homesteaders]] in the United States, under the Homestead Act of 1862. See [[Project: Homesteaders]] for more information.
The template places the profile into a Homesteaders category for the place where the person homesteaded, or into [[:Category: United States, Homesteaders]] if the location cannot be determined. Homesteaders categories exist for the counties (such as Frontier County, Nebraska) and states/territories (example: Nebraska) where homesteading occurred (or may have occurred).

prop.name: location
prop.help: The location where the person was a homesteader

prop.name: switch
prop.help:
Use "'''Scotland'''" for profiles in a trail badged by the Magna Carta Project that have Scotland Project as a manager (either co-manager with or instead of the Magna Carta Project).
Use "'''Scotland-pending'''" for profiles in a trail being developed or under review by the Magna Carta Project with the Scotland Project as a manager.

prop.name: name
prop.help: Can be used to overide default name (default is the profile's datafields "Preferred First Name" "Current Last Name") if a different display name is desired.
prop.example:
name=Liz (Noland) Shifflett

[instead of the default's "Liz Shifflett"]

It should only be applied to a profile by a member of the [[Project:Magna_Carta#Project_Leaders|Magna Carta Project leadership team]]. It is designed to be used in a "Magna Carta Project" section explaining why there is no Magna Carta trail. It can also be included in the "Magna Carta Project" section of a project-managed profile that has the project box <nowiki>{{Magna Carta|No Trail}} </nowiki>at the top of the profile.

templates.name: Penn Fleet Passenger
templates.subgroup: William Penn and Early Pennsylvania Settlers
templates.help: This sticker is for the profiles of people who emigrated from Europe to William Penn's Pennsylvania aboard [[:Category:Fleet of William Penn|23 ships in 1681 and 1682]] with William Penn and early members of the [[Project:Quakers|Society of Friends (Quakers)]].

templates.name: PGM Beyond
templates.help: This sticker is intended for use on profiles of people who immigrated to New England during the Puritan Great Migration (1621 to 1640) and subsequently departed for a place outside New England (for example, England or New York).  The sticker adds the profile to [[:Category: PGM Beyond New England]].  For more information, see [[Project: Puritan Great Migration|Puritan Great Migration Project]] and its [[Space:Puritan Great Migration Beyond New England|Puritan Great Migration Beyond New England]] sub-project.

prop.name: place
prop.help: The place where the person went after leaving New England

templates.name: PGM Minor Child
templates.help:
This sticker is intended for use on profiles of minor children (under age 21) who immigrated to New England with family between 1621 and 1640 as a part of the Puritan Great Migration (1621 to 1640). The sticker adds the profile to [[:Category: Puritan Great Migration Minor Child]]. For more information, see [[Project:Puritan Great Migration|Puritan Great Migration Project]].
When adding this sticker to a profile, please include the following as a comment on the profile to alert profile managers:
''This profile is part of the [https://www.wikitree.com/wiki/Project:Puritan_Great_Migration Puritan Great Migration (PGM) Project]. Please feel free to improve the profile by providing additional information and reliable sources. PGM encourages the Profile Managers to monitor this profile for changes; if any problems arise, please contact the PGM Project for assistance. Thank you.''

templates.name: Westward Ho Sticker
templates.help: This [[Help:Sticker|sticker]] identifies and recognizes profiles of people who were involved with the westward expansion of the United States. See the [[Project: Westward Ho|Westward Ho]] project page for more information and a list of sub-projects (which can also be seen in the Examples below).

prop.name: sub-project
prop.help: Changes default image and text to be the sub-project, and adds the sub-project's category.

prop.name: name
prop.help: Can be added to override the default name (which pulls information from the profile's name fields).

prop.name: location
prop.help: Use this parameter with sub-project=Homesteaders to change the default text and category to a specific location. Be sure to check the profile after adding this parameter to ensure the category exists (if the category name is in red, it does not exist). All relevant county and state categories already exist (see [https://plus.wikitree.com/function/WTCatNavigate/Category.htm?Category=Homesteaders&Levels=3 this list]).

prop.name: trail

prop.name: mini-project

prop.name: under
